metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14154 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Mutt before 1.14.3 proceeds with a connection even if, in response to a GnuTLS certificate prompt, the user rejects an expired intermediate certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mutt - 1.5.24-1ubuntu0.3
mutt-patched - 1.5.24-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mutt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.24-1ubuntu0.3').
